title: Pumpkin-themed food & drinks offered in Philly
text:
Pumpkin-themed food & drinks offered in Philly Whether you hate it or love it, the hype on pumpkin-themed food is here. Pumpkin-themed food & drinks offered in Philly Barren Hill offers pumpkin-themed beer alongside pumpkin pie. (photo by James Zeleniak) Travel Deals Posted: Wednesday, October 14, 2015, 3:07 PM 
Whether you hate it or love it, the hype on pumpkin-themed food is here. From local beers to pumpkin-infused treats, you can easily get your autumn-fix in Philadelphia. Philadelphia Brewing Company's Kenz O’ Latern (Various locations) You’re sure to try at least one pumpkin beer this year – try a local one! Philadelphia Brewing Companies Kenz O’ Lantern is a seasonal ale brewed with spices. The brew is available at bottle shops and select bars on draft. 
Barren Hill Tavern and Brewery pumpkin pie and beer (646 Germantown Pike) Barren Hill Tavern’s Chef Mel offers her signature pumpkin pie for a limited time that includes a spice cookie crust, whipped cream, and pumpkin seed brittle. The brewers love it so much; they decided to brew a special spiced ale to pair with it. Bon appétit! Little Baby’s gourd-inspired flavors (2311 Frankford Ave.) (4903 Catharine St.) Not only does one of the best ice cream shops in Philly sell a pumpkin flavor – they sell two different kinds! For the coffee fiends, Pumpkin Latte is an option; and for those who want an interesting choice, Pumpkin Speculoos is mixed with cookie crumbles and spices. ( All locations ) Yum. Iron Hill’s pumpkin beer wasn’t the only spiced flavor coming out of the brewery this fall. While you sip on this seasonal ale, pair it up with their pumpkin sriracha wings which give off a sweet start and end with a fiery finish. Pumpkin galore at McGillin’s Old Ale House (1310 Drury St.) McGillin’s loves pumpkin-themed cuisine so much they decided to focus on more than one kitchen item here. For drinks: Order a pumpkin martini, or if you prefer it a little darker – go with a chocolate pumpkin martini. There’s no shortage of gourd eats here. The kitchen offers pumpkin themed mac and cheese, soup, stew, pie, and more. Shane’s Confectionary assortment collection (110 Market St.) The classic candy store located on Market Street can satisfy your fall sweet tooth with pumpkin-flavored fudge, chocolate, caramels, and creams. The candies make great presents, too! 
Marigold Kitchen’s pumpkin faux foie (501 S. 45th St.) As part of the BYOB restaurant’s fall menu, guests can get their seasonal fixings in with a pumpkin faux foie: a foie gras slow cooked in brandy and rosemary, seared and placed on a coin of toasted brioche.
